# Directors Guild of America Award for Outstanding Directing – Documentaries

| caption       = The 2024 recipients: Brendan Bellomo and Slava Leontyev
| awarded_for   = Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Documentaries
| presenter     = Directors Guild of America
| country       = United States
| year          = 1991
| holder        = Brendan Bellomo and Slava Leontyev for Porcelain War (2024)
}}
The Directors Guild of America Award for Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Documentaries is one of the annual Directors Guild of America Awards given by the Directors Guild of America. It was first awarded at the 44th Directors Guild of America Awards in 1992. The DGA Documentary Awards Committee is currently co-chaired by Yance Ford and Patrick Creadon.
Ari Folman's Waltz with Bashir remains the only animated film to ever won a DGA award.
